value.title: Biden education secretary nominee pushed ‘microaggression’ resources in response to riots
value.excerpt: Elect Joe Biden nominated Connecticut Education Commissioner Miguel Cardona to serve as head of the Department of Education in his administration, a public school advocate who sent around resources on "microaggressions" as he took action to help parents and educators navigate difficult race-related discussions earlier this year.

value.title: Biden's plans on further COVID19 relief aid?
value.excerpt: Watch "What are President-elect Joe Biden's plans on further COVID-19 relief aid?", a CBSN video on CBSNews.com. View more CBSN videos and watch CBSN, a live news stream featuring original CBS News reporting.

value.title: Biden: No 'obvious choice' yet for attorney general
value.excerpt: The president-elect also re-upped his commitment to not discuss his son's legal troubles with any AG candidates.

value.title: Biden gets vaccine, says 'nothing to worry about'
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden on Monday received his first dose of the coronavirus vaccine on live television as part of a growing effort to convince the American public the inoculations are safe. (Dec. 2

value.title: Fierce pushback, fear of new and onerous regulations from small farmers on Joe Biden’s choice of Tom Vilsack for USDA
value.excerpt: Tom Vilsack faces a steep challenge, with progressive and environmental groups warning that he is too friendly with big industrial agriculture businesses.

value.title: AG Barr says he sees no reason to name special counsels to investigate Hunter Biden or election fraud
value.excerpt: Attorney General Barr said he saw no reason to appoint special counsels to investigate Hunter Biden or unsubstantiated allegations of election fraud.

value.title: Biden looks to Susan Rice to elevate low-profile Domestic Policy Council
value.excerpt: "Susan will elevate and turbocharge a revitalized" council, Joe Biden said when he nominated the former national security adviser.

value.title: Biden mulls punishments for Russia over suspected role in government hack
value.excerpt: President-elect will consider options for unprecedented hacking of US government agencies

value.title: Biden's impact on federal judiciary may be limited despite liberals' talk of 'court-packing'
value.excerpt: Beyond racial and ethnic demographics and job experiences, Biden's impact on the judiciary is not likely to be as dramatic as Trump's has been.

value.title: On ‘SNL,’ Jim Carrey Steps Aside for Alex Moffat, the New ‘Joe Biden’
value.excerpt: The comedy star’s high-energy impression of the president-elect polarized viewers. But other impersonators say getting Biden right is tougher than it looks.

value.title: 'Folks, we're in crisis': Joe Biden introduces environmental advisers
value.excerpt: President-elect announces racially diverse team to face ‘existential threat of our time’

value.title: Biden taps Brenda Mallory to lead White House Council on Environmental Quality
value.excerpt: In Wilmington, Del., on Dec. 19, President-elect Joe Biden introduced Obama administration veteran Brenda Mallory as his pick to serve as the first Black chair of the White House Council on Environmental Quality.

value.title: Jim Carrey hanging up his Joe Biden ‘SNL’ impression
value.excerpt: Jim Carrey is turning in his aviators and giving up his gig of impersonating Joe Biden on "Saturday Night Live."

value.title: Sir David Attenborough on Joe Biden, Christmas wrapping... and flamingos
value.excerpt: Like many of us, Sir David Attenborough has had to adapt to new ways of working since the coronavirus pandemic took hold this spring. For his latest series, the 93-year-old - who has been shielding - had to record some of his voiceovers from his home in south-west London.

value.title: Mr. Biden shouldn’t be the only target for Catholics

value.title: Biden transition head speaks out on 'difficult and intense' process

value.title: ‘He called me kiddo’: Jill Biden says WSJ essay was ‘such a surprise’
value.excerpt: "One of the things I'm most proud of is my doctorate," incoming First Lady Jill Biden told Stephen Colbert while responding to the WSJ's controversial op-ed.

value.title: Joe Biden Wears a ‘Kick Me’ Sign
value.excerpt: Critics like AOC and Sanders believe there is no price to be paid, and benefits to be gained, by publicly pressuring the new administration.

value.title: Biden's incoming deputy chief of staff apologizes for calling Republicans 'a bunch of f---ers'
value.excerpt: "I used some words that I probably could have chosen better," O'Malley Dillon said on Thursday, per a Politico report.

value.title: Betsy DeVos tells Education Department employees to 'resist' Biden administration, report says
value.excerpt: The education secretary under President Trump reportedly told agency workers to “be the resistance" against changes they believe could hurt students.

value.title: Biden to tap North Carolina environmental regulator Regan to head EPA
value.excerpt: The pick is a major nod to the party's progressive wing that pushed Biden's team to emphasize minority and poor communities facing threats from pollution.

value.title: Exclusive: New agreement needed to revive Iran nuclear deal under Biden, IAEA chief says
value.excerpt: Reviving Iran's nuclear deal under U.S. President-elect Joe Biden would require striking a new agreement setting out how Iran's breaches should be reversed, U.N. atomic watchdog chief Rafael Grossi said.

value.title: KT McFarland: There is 'significant evidence' Hunter Biden has been 'compromised by Chinese'
value.excerpt: Former Deputy National Security Adviser K.T. McFarland echoed calls Wednesday from top Republican lawmakers urging President Trump to appoint a special counsel to investigate Hunter Biden’s business dealings in China.

value.title: Macklem: Biden's arrival could eliminate Canada's competitive edge on immigration
value.excerpt: The Trudeau government has talked up the importance of attracting top global talent as part of its pursuit of stronger economic growth.

value.title: Fact check: Laptop repairman at center of Hunter Biden saga is alive
value.excerpt: Some users on Facebook have falsely claimed John Paul Mac Isaac — the laptop repairman at the center of the Hunter Biden laptop saga — was found dead.

value.excerpt: The new administration confronts decaying infrastructure and a military justice system moving at a glacial pace.

value.title: A talk with France’s ambassador: On Biden, climate accord and restoring allies’ trust
value.excerpt: The Times speaks with Philippe Etienne, France's envoy to the U.S., on Biden's promise to rejoin the five-year-old Paris Accord that Trump disavowed.
